curation.publisher: USNOFS Image and Catalogue Archive operated by the United States Naval Observatory, Flagstaff Station
curation.creator: USNOFS PMM project

description.abstract: USNO-B1.0 is an all-sky catalog that presents positions, proper motions, magnitudes in various optical passbands, and star/galaxy estimators for 1,042,618,261 objects derived from 3,643,201,733 separate observations. The data were obtained from scans of 7,435 Schmidt plates taken for the various sky surveys during the last 50 years. USNO-B1.0 is believed to provide all-sky coverage, completeness down to V = 21, 0.2 arcsecond astrometric accuracy at J2000, 0.3 magnitude photometric accuracy in up to five colors, and 85% accuracy for distinguishing stars from non-stellar objects.

identity.title: The First XMM-Newton Serendipitous Source Catalogue: 1XMM

description.abstract: 1XMM is the first comprehensive catalogue of serendipitousX-ray sources from the European Space Agency (ESA) XMM-Newton observatorylaunched in December 1999, and has been constructed by the XMM-NewtonSurvey Science Centre (SSC) on behalf of ESA. The catalogue containssource detections drawn from 585 XMM-Newton EPIC observations made between2000 March 1 and 2002 May 5.

identity.title: Isaac Newton Telescope Wide Field Survey

description.abstract: The INT Wide Field Survey (WFS) is using the Wide FieldCamera ( 0.3 square degrees) on the 2.5m Isaac Newton Telescope (INT). Theproject was initiated in August 1998 and is expected to have a duration ofup to five years. Multicolour data will be obtained over 200+ squaredegrees to a typical depth of 25 mag (u-prime through z-prime). The datais publically accessible via the Cambridge Astronomical Survey Unit to UKand NL communities from day one, with access to the rest of the worldafter one year.

This is the registry service entry for the MSSL community. Elizabeth Auden has entered this entry as a test case for querying the registry for community metadata. Please disregard the information returned.

This is the registry service entry for the MSSL mySpace. Elizabeth Auden has entered this entry as a test case for querying the registry for mySpace metadata. Please disregard the information returned.

curation.publisher: MERLIN/VLBI National Facilty, Jodrell Bank Observatory, University of Manchester, UK
curation.creator: MERLIN staff

description.abstract: This database contains a log of MERLIN archive data since 1991 which have been partially reduced and are electronically available. Calibrated visibility data typically cover 10 arcmin+2 around each pointing position listed. Maps of the centre of each field are available on-line; other images and data products may be obtained on request. Most continuum data at around 1.4-1.6 and 5 GHz have been reduced. Spectral line observations and observations at 0.4 and 22 GHz are not listed here but the MERLIN archive home page provides a search form; consult MERLIN staff to obtain data. NB the README below is slightly out of date.
The SURF archive holds data from Yohkoh, SOHO-CDS, TRACE and ReSIK, as well as ancillary and ground-based data.
